[![Vizierdb](data:image/png;base64,)](https://demo.vizierdb.info)
# Vizier - Full Stack Docker Image
 
This image is based on Alpine Linux image - a 5MB image - and contains
[OracleJDK 8.](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/overview/index.html)
You must accept the
[Oracle Binary Code License Agreement for Java SE](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/terms/license/index.html)
to use this image

#### Run the image from the docker.mimirdb.info registry.
By default everything runs on localhost with http scheme. The UI listens on port 3000 in the container and can be mapped to the desired port on the host.  The API server listens on port 5000 in the container and can not be mapped to a different port without specifying additional parameters.
```sh
$ docker run -t -i -p 3000:3000 -p 5000:5000 docker.mimirdb.info/vizier
```

To run things on a different hostname or scheme, or map the API port to something other than 5000 some environment parameters can be specified.  This way, for example nginx and letsencrypt may be used to apply tls and proxy requests to the container. 
```sh
$ docker run -t -i -p 3000:3000 -p 5000:5000 -e "API_SCHEME=https" -e "API_SERVER=demo.vizierdb.info" -e "API_PORT=443" -e "API_LOCAL_PORT=5000"  docker.mimirdb.info/vizier
```
#### Build the image
Alternatively, the image can be built from the Dockerfile in this repo:
```sh
$ docker build <path/where/dockerfile/is/cloned> --build-arg gituser=<your_vizierdb_git_user> --build-arg gitpass=<and_password>
```


##### Note: when running or building this docker image make sure that docker has at minimum 2.2 GB of memory allocated, otherwise it will fail.
